Comment: I've been seeing more and more calls for a general strike recently..  It‚Äôs not happening. People are broke, scared, and stuck. They're too worried about keeping a roof over their heads and feeding their children to risk their paycheck.  If we all wait for a general strike to come and solve all our problems, nothing is ever going to happen.  There‚Äôs another option, and its something that *you* can do *literally today* without actually really impacting your livelihood: **simple sabotage**.  The OSS (precursor to the CIA) trained people on how to ratfuck governments and corporations from the inside during WW2, and [their handbook is available here on Project Gutenberg](https://www.gutenberg.org/cache/epub/26184/pg26184-images.html).  Essentially: Work slower. Follow every pointless rule (and make new ones if you're able). Start office drama. ‚ÄúMisunderstand‚Äù orders. Drown everything in meetings. Lose paperwork. Be a burden. Be a roadblock. Be dead weight. Do everything you can to just make things a bit worse every day.  Big flashy strikes can get crushed - especially now that you cannot depend on labor laws to be there to protect you. Simple sabotage guts the system from the inside, and it is practically transparent on the individual level. "I'm not a shit employee, the process is just important.. how about we all meet for a few hours next week to think about better ways of doing things."  It‚Äôs not heroic. It‚Äôs not pretty.  But it works.  Death by a thousand cuts still kills.
